algorithm_technique: Sliding window with two sorted lists to maintain median-like property
problem_summary_simple: Find minimum operations to make any k-sized subarray have equal elements.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a sliding window and two SortedLists to efficiently track elements and their sums, aiming to minimize operations to equalize a subarray.
key_insights: The problem can be reframed as finding a target value for a k-sized subarray that minimizes operations.
Using two sorted lists (left and right) helps maintain a balanced set of elements within the window, approximating the median.
The rebalancing logic ensures that the median (or near-median) is always accessible for cost calculation.
